column4: when I use vim inside of screen, I don't have a 256 color term anymore.  Is there a way around this?
I ssh into my machine at work, use vim, it's 256 colors.  Open a screen -D -R on that server, use vim, it's 16 colors
ok, well I don't get it...I can't even use vim it's so garish in 16 color mode.
in previous versions I had to rebuild screen, but that isn't the case in hardy
well, I'll rebuild screen later I supopse
the machine was an upgrade, not a hardy base install
well, you don't have to in hardy.  Check what version of the screen package you have
nah, what version of the ubuntu package?  apt-cache policy screen
make sure t_Co is really set to 256 with just ':set t_Co' inside vim in screen
